results.title: Le Bal du Regent = the Regent's Ball
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Lagardere”.
Aurore has moved in with Suzanne, Lagardere’s old nanny, to try and avoid the spies sent by Philippe de Gonzague. Henri is trying to track down Blanche, Aurore’s mother. Little does he know that she is now married to Philippe de Gonzague. Gonzague has devised a scheme to introduce to Blanche a young orphan named Flor who is to pass for Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin, Dominique Paturel.

results.title: Aurore
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Lagardere”.
Lagardere is in hiding in Spain with Aurore. He is still seeking to kill all those involved in that fateful night at Caylus 15 years ago. Each of his murders his signed with the famous ‘Nevers lunge’, a bloodied star on the forehead of the victim. Philippe has married Blanche in the hope of seizing her estate. He also keeps an army of informers whose mission it is to locate Lagardere and kidnap Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

results.title: Tgv, Ariane
results.brief_description:
The first segment explores the Ariane launching centre in Kourou (Fr. Guyanna). The second segment takes us on board a high-speed train on the day a speed record of 380 km/h is established.

Credits: No credits available.

results.title: Jean-Pierre Melville Cineaste
results.brief_description:
This short film follows Jean-Pierre Melville during the filming of ‘The Shadow Army’. Melville explains his interest in WWII which stems from his involvement in the Resistance movement and later on led to his filming an adaptation of ‘Le Silence de la Mer’. He confides his fascination for American cinema where action matters first and foremost.

Credits: Director, Jacques Dupont.

results.title: Le Dejeuner Sur L'herbe = Picnic in the Grass
results.brief_description:
Jean Renoir never made any secret that ‘Le Dejeuner sur L’Herbe’ was inspired by the impressionist paintings of his father Auguste Renoir, and also of Edouard Monet. A pompous Parisian professor concerned with artificial insemination, finds himself seduced by the mysteries of the countryside and the farmer’s daughter. Shot almost entirely at Les Collettes, the Renoir family home near Cannes, its sensuous colours and sunlit images derive from the Impressionists.

Credits: Producer, Ginette Doynel ; director, Jean Renoir ; writer, Jean Renoir ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Paul Meurisse, Catherine Rouvel, Fernand Sardou, Ingrid Nordine.

results.title: Francoise Hardy
results.brief_description: Biopic portrait of the solitary French pop chanteuse. A clip for ‘Peau de chagrin” offers an elliptical tour of chez Hardy. A further melancholy filmclip provides vicarious intercutting of candid Paris street scenes - notable for gratuitous footage of French youngsters gamely drawing back on Celtique cigarettes.
